dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Moving through a murky haze.  Dark blues and greens, shaf of prismed purple.  A pale shard appears in the distance. Gliding closer, a group of tiny fish dart before the came We're UNDERWATER.  Arriving at the form, it finally sharp into focus.  It's a WOMAN'S BODY submerged in dark water, arms floating lazily at her side.  The face is obscured b flowing hair.  All that is visible is a pair of COLD, STA GREEN EYES, which blink closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then open as BLUE EYES, as a DIFFERENT FACE emerges fr water.  CLAIRE SPENCER awakens from this unsettling dream her bathtub.  She pivots the large BRASS SHOWER HEAD (the kind that moves up and down on a pipe) off to one side, reaches toward her feet and we hear the sound of a plug b pulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAZY SHAPE-- accompanied by a whirring sound. A steam covered mirror is cleared with a BLOW DRYER.  Cla starts to come into focus.  The dryer stops.  She presses red G.F.I. button on the socket.  ZAP!  A big blue spark shoots out.  Claire pulls her hand back...and the dryer starts whirring again. She clears the mirror and replaces the dryer on a hook. regards herself in the mirror, and attractive, elegant- looking woman around forty. Claire traces a finger along a small but noticeable SCAR above her left eye, then slowly drops the hand to her che as if confirming her existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, now dressed, presses her face against a door, listening for the sounds of stirring from within.  Silenc She quietly pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire makes her way past half-filled boxes and duffels t window, then pulls the curtains to reveal: A LOVELY, WOODED LAKE.  It couldn't be more picturesque. 24' SAILBOAT is moored at the dock and an OLD STONE LIGHTHOUSE sits on a point across the lake. The sunlight motivates an unconscious groan from A FIGURE still shrouded by covers. Claire sits beside the sleeping form.  She scans the room briefly, taking in a Greenpeace flag and a picture of a tomboyish ten year-old girl at camp. She gently pulls back the covers and peers down at the sa face, now a waifish, pretty seventeen year-old, with chop hair and tiny nose ring.  Claire leans over and inhales t sleeping scent of her only daughter, CAITLIN.  She places hand on a cheek.  The girl's eyelids flutter softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, beauty. Caitlin lets out a grunt and rolls over onto her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.  Or we'll never leave on time. From out of the pillow comes Caitlin's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled) I'm totally ready. Claire glances around at the piles of unpacked clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll make you some waffles, maybe we'll squeeze in a trip to the mall. (beat) Caitlin... Claire gently swats at the tiny lump that is Caitlin's behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother... Claire stands and instinctively scoops up some clothes fr the floor, then folds and neatly stacks them on a box. Caitlin turns her head sideways on the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a morning person. Claire turns at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is unwise to heckle the keeper of the plastic. She starts to leave.  Caitlin calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blueberries! Claire smiles as she closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire bends down to pick up one of Caitlin's socks.  Whe she stands, something catches her eye out a window.  She gazes down, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a stand of trees over a HIGH WOODEN FENCE, A YOUN COUPLE is in the midst of a heated argument next door. Claire watches as the HUSBAND, a large imposing man with unruly shock of red hair, snarls at his wife across the h of their huge old Buick.  She tries to get a glimpse of t woman, but all that's visible is THE BACK OF HER BLOND HE A TAN, SINEWY ARM encircles Claire's waist.  She lets out small gasp as a hand closes on her breast.  It's Claire's husband, DR. NORMAN SPENCER, nibbling gently at her neck. He's older than she, pushing fifty, with silver streaks beginning to permeate the shaggy mop of hair that makes h look more like a preppy rocker or a lacrosse coach than t prominent academic that he is.  Claire, however, can't ta her eyes off the scene below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They at it again? Claire nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, that's twice in...When did they move in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three weeks. She continues to gaze downward.  The man leans over the h murmuring darkly at his wife, though for Claire and Norma the scene is entirely silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's their name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feur, I think.  Psych department.  Figures. They're all psychotic. Outside, Mr. Feur turns and walks toward his house.  Norm begins, once again, to nuzzle Claire.  Her eyes close, bu then she gently demurs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be quiet.  Quick and quiet. She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be either. He smiles.  A really good smile.  The lips and tongue on faded T-shirt mark him as a 'Stones fan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's she out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman Spencer. Norman gives up.  He busses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving toward the stairs) Alright.  I can't take the rejection.  I'm going to class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, I have to show up for the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Saturday. Norman stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew that.  You think I didn't know that? She smiles at him.  After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistfully) Yep. They share a warm, poignant look.  He turns and moves dow the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling over his shoulder) We're going to have to leave by three if we want to beat the traffic. Claire returns her gaze to the scene below as Mr. Feur sa something ominous to his wife, then stalks into the house

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absently) Three o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Feur drops her face into her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire peruses her "to do" list as Caitlin munches a pani

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I still think we should get you some mittens. Caitlin puts down the sandwich and regards her mother war The bond between them is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a scarf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Claire looks up from her little pad of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only two hours away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come back all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, you're going to be fine. Claire smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, I've known this day was coming for a long time.  I've got your father and the garden and the new house. You really don't have to worry. Caitlin smiles back and nods, her face betraying some concern.  Claire takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. She nods reassuringly and pulls Caitlin into an embrace. eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire's frozen in the hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Mom. Her eyes open.  Widen to reveal Claire, holding Caitlin o the college campus.  The URBAN SKYLINE looms in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have'ta go. After a moment's hesitation, she releases her grip.  Cait glances over her shoulder to make sure no one's witnessed this overt display of maternal affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you. Claire produces an ENVELOPE, which she presses into her daughter's hand.  It's a book of TRAIN TICKETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come home anytime. Caitlin looks at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really gonna leave me, huh? She nods.  They share a tender look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be good. She throws her arm, briefly, tightly around his waist.  A overwhelmed, he slowly brings his hand to the back of Caitlin's head.  After a moment, she steps back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. ...then turns and makes her way toward the large, old Columbia dorm.  A banner is draped across its portals whi reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire watches her daughter melt into a crowd of similarl shaggy freshmen, smoking and talking on the front steps. eyes are shining.  Norman wraps an arm around her waist a she daps at a tear with a Kleenex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I almost made it. They turn and head for the car.  Claire sneaks one last l over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caitlin glancing back at Claire with an apprehensive smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in from the bathroom wearing a sexy cotton nightgown.  Norman is in bed, absorbed in some notes. She gets into bed, then picks up a thick text from beside and starts reading.  After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha reading?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the cover, sexy voice) Genetic repair mechanisms in eukaryotic organisms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight smile) How is it? Claire snuggles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  Couple of Swedish sailor cells just gang divided a virginal cheerleader cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lost in his book) Nice. (beat) Almost done. She pulls slightly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you have to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  I'm just about... (beat) There. He places his book on the bedside table and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay if you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just she's been the focus for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. Claire thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell you the truth...I'm excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get my life back.  To have some time for myself.  Some time for us. He caresses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did a great job.  She's a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did. There's a weighty pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna fool around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. They start to kiss.  It's slow and a bit methodical in th manner of long time lovers.  Suddenly, the SOUND OF A WOM WAILING can be heard.  They stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. They listen.  The sounds start to become louder.  It is clearly two people in the throes of some very vocal and savage love making.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. He walks over and closes the window.  It doesn't help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess they're making up. The woman's moaning becomes embarrassingly loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing to her? They lie together in silence as the cacophony drones on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we moved out here for the quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Beat.  The mood has passed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm finished at three.  No.  Squash with Stan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night. They lie together in the darkness as the Feurs finally climax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pushes open the door to Caitlin's room carrying an armful of FOLDED LAUNDRY.  She moves quickly to the burea not wanting to spend much time in here, then grabs a TINY BLACK TOP from the pile, and drops it into a drawer.  She just about to close it, when something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops the laundry and slowly pulls a tattered, old JUILLIARD T-SHIRT with a very seventies logo from the dra Claire gazes around the room, which is a reliquary of Caitlin's recently concluded childhood; PICTURES, TROPHIE STUFFED ANIMALS. She brings the now faded T-shirt to her face and drinks i the smells.  She stares down at the word "Juilliard."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "JUILLIARD"...now it's on the same T-shirt only Claire's wearing it and she's much younger.  It's an old photograp an album.  Younger Norman stands next to her in the shot, arm draped around her waist.  A CELLO CASE stands beside Claire glances around at several hastily unpacked boxes a sees propped in the corner...THE CELLO CASE.  She gazes a other photos. -- Claire in her wedding dress, Norman beside her in a tu with a very wide bow-tie. -- Claire and Norman in front of a UNIVERSITY BUILDING. tiny Caitlin rests on her hip. Claire's chin begins to tremble and she chokes out a sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face streaked with tears, Claire stumbles out into th immaculately manicured ROSE GARDEN. The yard is surrounded by a HIGH WOODEN FENCE.  She colla into a lawn chair as the tears begin to subside.  Suddenl she hears something coming from next door. She cocks her head and attempts to make out the sound.  I is, ironically, the sound of a WOMAN CRYING.  Claire make her way over to the fence.  The women's sobbing becomes m plaintive and fevered. She places her face against the prickly, vine covered fen and tries to peer through the crack.  All she can make ou A DARK BLUE BLUR that seems to be rocking.  Claire gather her nerve and calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... There's no reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Feur? The sobbing chokes down to a breathless whimpering.  The shape vanishes from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  I just want-- Something bumps against the fence.  Claire draws back.  S hears heavy breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sniffling) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Mrs...It's Claire...Spencer.  From next door.  Is everything--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the flower lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen you.  From the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright? Claire leans closer to the tiny crack.  She sees a fleshy blur and what might be part of an eye.  There's no respon just the breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not... She seems on the verge of losing it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so...it's too much...and I can't...I can't breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?  Your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm afraid.  Oh god, I'm so afraid of... She trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, no, no, I can't... Claire edges closer to the crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I'll just...that one day I'll just...disappear. Beat.  Claire's taken aback by this admission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.  I can help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  How can you help me?  With your flowers and your perfect life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not...It's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never even met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  And I'm sorry.  I've been consumed with...my daughter left...for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This fence...it's so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  It's for the flowers.  Why don't you... Tires can be heard crunching the gravel as a car pulls in the Feur's driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God.  He's back.  I'm sorry.  Please forget that I...I don't know what I'm saying.  Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Don't go... Claire listens to the sound of NAKED FOOTSTEPS, followed LARGE FRONT DOOR swinging shut.  A CAR DOOR swings open a MAN'S SHOES follow down the path. Claire pulls back from the crack and leans against the fe as the door closes a second time.  She sits there for a moment listening, but all is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sounded terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Norman eat dinner.  A rainstorm pelts the wind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of him I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less. Norman chews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, they're young.  They're probably newlyweds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you.  There was something in her voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember how we were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this.  We were never like this. (beat) I want to go over there.  After dinner, we can--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make sure she's all right. Norman puts down his fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, honey, we are not going to march next door and accuse our new neighbor of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) That's not what I'm sug--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...when tonight they'll probably be keeping us awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if something happens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd never be able to live with mysel--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) Nothing's going to happen. (beat) Besides, I have to work tonight.  The conference is in less than two weeks. I've got to stay focused on that for just a little longer. (beat) This is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I've been working for. She glances down at her untouched plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish you could have heard her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'll call Harvey Tomes in the Psych department, see what I can find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise? He gives her a "Didn't I just say so" look.  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you some coffee. She reaches for his plate to clear it.  Norman grabs her and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman snores softly.  Claire is awakened by the continui STORM.  She pads out to Norman's turreted library.  Rain pelts the glass.  Her face is briefly illuminated by the LIGHTHOUSE BEAM. She hears the sound of a DOOR CLOSING and moves to get a better view of the Feur's.  Nothing but blackness.  Just she's turning to go back to bed.  A LIGHTNING FLASH light the night.  Claire's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the split second of brilliance, she sees Mr. Feur, in shirtsleeves, drenched, dragging A LARGE DUFFEL toward th open trunk of his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a hoarse whisper) Norman! He's dead to the world.  She calls to him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, you have to look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmnph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry... Another flash illuminates...Norman at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! ...an EMPTY DRIVEWAY, then blackness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  What's the matter? She stares down into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  There was...I thought I saw something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it gone? THE BEACON illuminates the empty driveway.  She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go back to bed. Yet another bolt of lightning reveals Claire, still at th window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sets up a camera and tripod.  She steps back and a her camera.  She glances up at a large upstairs window at FEUR'S HOUSE.  One side of the curtain seems to be pulled open, but no one's there. Feeling self-conscious, she turns back to the camera.  Th morning sun hits the flowers just right and she SNAPS SEV PICTURES OF THEM against her lovely house. She glances back at the Feur's window.  The CURTAIN IS NO CLOSED. She walks over to the fence and tries to peek through it. When this doesn't work, she drags a lawn chair over and p across the fence.  She can barely see over, but glimpses: A DEEP FURROW in the mud of the driveway.  Just then, a c pulls into the driveway, Claire scrambles down from her perch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks out to find her best friend, JODY, pretty, i her forties, wearing hip, hippie-ish clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there. Jody hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does everyone find that so surprising?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (are you kidding?) Cause...your...only daughter just went away to school...who you were incredibly close with aaand I'd be tripping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm a little tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well good.  So you're human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so far my day has consisted of taking pictures of my roses for the garden club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  Got here just in time. (reaching into her bag) I brought you this. She proffers several homemade tea bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kambucha mushroom tea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It soothes heart-ache and promotes psychic wellness.  Sela suggested I bring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're discussing me with your psychic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not a psychic.  Just a very enlightened spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing it into her hand) So you'll have some later. (beat) Notice anything...different? Claire gives her friend the once over, then notices the m Karman-Ghia behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.  You bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's niiice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful thing, alimony.  Lose a husband, get a car.  Think it'll help me pick up dudes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I've gotta run.  I just thought I'd stop by and see if you want to take the boat out, say Thursday morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it. Jody grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you then. Jody drives off.  Claire walks down the driveway to her f door and sees Mr. Feur staring at her from a window.  She starts to wave, but the curtain is drawn shut. Claire arrives at the front door and reaches out to touch doorknob.  She stops.  A FAINT RUSTLING can be heard from within.  Claire quietly opens the door and moves into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stops inside the door.  Now it sounds like WHISPER Two voices, tense, impassioned.  It seems to be coming fr Norman's study.  She gathers her nerve, then bursts into room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the whispering has suddenly stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? The lovely circular room is completely empty.  She looks around, puzzled.  Cooper, the family's aging lab, casuall ambles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cooper) Please tell me you heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Cooper, out on a walk, emerge onto large rocks the water's edge.  Claire tosses a long stick for Cooper, bolts out onto the LONG WOODEN DOCK.  Claire gazes at the LIGHTHOUSE across the lake and a long BRIDGE in the dista Cooper starts BARKING and looking down into the water. Claire arrives at Cooper's side and stares down into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper...what do you see? She looks down and sees nothing but her own reflection. After a moment, she notices a FAINT WHITE SHAPE directly the reflection of her face.  Cooper rumbles a low growl. shape seems to be gaining definition.

dialogues.speaker: RRRING
dialogues.text: Claire gasps quietly, then reaches into a pocket in her sweater and pulls out a cordless phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the other end) I'm stuck here for another couple of hours. Claire's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you need me to come home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  It's fine. Claire slowly leans out over the water to check her reflection...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? ...but the shape is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  Absolutely.  Take your time. She clicks off the phone and looks down at the calm water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits in a small workroom at a computer.  She focus intently on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ALICE'S COMPUTER SOLITAIRE.  She flips the last card an animated Queen of Hearts, accompanied by a series of musical notes, parades across the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on computer) You lost!  Off with your head! Claire hits "New Game" and watches as a fresh hand of cyb solitaire is dealt.  She suddenly has a thought and disappears into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at Jody's tea, smiles, then refills her glass red wine.  She picks up the phone from its cradle and mov into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dials a number.  LOUD REGGAE can be heard blaring thr the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining to be heard) Hello?  I'm looking for Caitlin Spencer. She's in 314...Well, could you check? She plugs one ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well, just tell her that her mother called.  Her mother.  Thank you.  Excuse me, how can you study with that? The noise abruptly stops.  Claire clicks off the phone an replaces it in the sweater pocket.  She tunes the stereo classical music station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in, places the cordless phone on a BASE UNIT, t hears a different set of musical notes from the computer. She stares at the screen, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game has been finished.  Cards with faces swarm chaotically across the screen with the message:  YOU WIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Kay. Without warning, the radio dial rips cacophonously past several stations and comes to a stop on some angry, punki rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... She bolts around a corner to the stereo.  The music is chaotic and deafening.  She finds Cooper growling at...no one.  She turns off the stereo.  Cooper suddenly bolts do the hall.  She follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foyer's empty, but the front door is open.  Claire nervously walks out and looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cooper!

dialogues.speaker: THE GARDEN
dialogues.text: No sign of the dog. Claire turns to go back inside.  When she touches the doorknob, she hears the whispering again.  A fleeting sha draws her eye to a COAT RACK MIRROR which reflects direct into the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...?! The whispering stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in to find Norman surrounded by several GRAD STUDENTS.  At school he's a very different man; pressed s and tie, hair neatly brushed back.  They're preforming so unseen procedure on a live sheep in a containment harness She stops by the door to watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then what...Courtney? An intense ASIAN GIRL answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We administer the Halothane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dosage? She glances at her notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three point five cc's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  Properties?  Andrew from downtown... Andrew, tall razor thin, was waiting for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An organic, neuromuscular blocking agent, which when administered in aerosol form temporarily renders the subject immobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but net. He measures out the liquid from a blue plastic bottle int apparatus connected to an inhalation mask on the sheep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prudence here's an old friend. He moves to the sheep's head and strokes it as he nods to Courtney who turns a valve on the apparatus.  The sheep suddenly goes completely still.  Norman moves around and begins a brief procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I try to stay on her good side because I owe her my career and most of our grant money.  Why else? He completes the procedure.  They look at him blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always do unto others as you'd have others do unto your ewe. Groans, laughter.  He stops Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll do it.  Write this up for Tuesday! Andrew and Amy tend to Prudence, the rest leave.  Claire moves over to him.  They kiss.  Norman packs notes and so of the chemicals into a LEATHER CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warm) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were some noises.  I didn't want to disturb you. She watches as the sheep slowly becomes reanimated and is out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  Some noises where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the house.  I was scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Can you drive me home?  I'll bring you back in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. He takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman pushes open the front door.  Cooper pads over, wag his tail.  They walk together past the stereo into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the living room.  All is quiet.  They move into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's undisturbed.  Norman checks the window locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was there.  This angry music all by itself.  And I heard whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of whispering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Just...whispering. He nods as Cooper appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you see, Coop? The dog stares blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cooper) Tell him! Norman smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sits on the bed and pulls off his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have the police check on the house. Claire leans against the window sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great, "Can you look in on my wife, she's hearing voices?"  Wait'll that gets around. He walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the conference next week.  I want you to feel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, I do.  I'm sure I'm just...how was your day? He goes to his dresser and fishes a little joint from a b in his dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think I may have cracked it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? She produces a match and lights it.  They sit on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.  Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Curie, Jonas Salk, Norman Spencer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You know what that does to me. She takes a little puff on the joint as he kisses her nec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Ohmigod.  You'll never believe...I saw Schumway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here giving some arcane spiel for the physics department, so Bob Shine introduces us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. He nods, Claire passes the joint back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he says...you'll fucking love this, he says, "Doctor Spencer, I am a great admirer of your work..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...especially Spencer's Theorem..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Oh, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...of Perpetual Distances." (beat) Everybody's checking their shoelaces. Pins drop.  "I'm afraid you've mistaken me,"  I say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) That's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...for my father."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know he was dead, every stinking paper on the globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just mean. (indicating joint) Oh.  Jody wanted to know if I could get her some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly glancing over) Did you tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  No.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Norman, you are so funny about that.  No, I didn't. He takes a little toke, then vanishes into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause that would be really-- She lays back on the bed.  Sounds of flushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. He reappears without the joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  You understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call about the Feurs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  Yes.  Harvey says the guy's a sweetheart.  Wouldn't hurt a fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Claire ponders this.  Norman turns off the light and join her on the bed.  He kisses her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the brilliant Norman stuff some more. Then starts working his way up her thigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And speak up. Claire smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits frozen, cello between her legs, bow hovering position.  After an uncomfortable long pause, she touches to string, drawing in a breath at the power of the sound. Claire takes another deep breath, then launches into a beautiful and melancholy piece of music.  She's very, ver good.  Eyes closed.  Her body begins to sway slightly as left hand vibratos like butterfly wings on the neck. She reaches a difficult transition and falters.  She seem almost surprised.  She attacks the transition again, and again falters.  Claire bites her lower lip and tries yet again, this time failing completely. She sits back in the chair, despondent.  Almost as an afterthought, she sadly drags the bow across strings.  At end of the tone, something catches her ear.  She can just make out the HINT OF A FAINT FEMININE VOICE echoing the t She sits up and plays a different note, then another.  Ea time the soft mournful voice becomes more distinct.  Fina she plays a sharp, higher pitched note.  The voice echoes with a distinct, unsettling shriek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in and sees: INSERT-- Lying on the floor...A FRAMED NEWSPAPER PHOTOGRA OF NORMAN AND CLAIRE. The caption announces that he's being promoted to the "distinguished DUPONT CHAIR IN GENETICS."  Through the spiderwebbed glass, Norman can be seen shaking hands with older academic, hugging a smiling Claire to his side. Claire kneels down to gather the picture.  A single shard glass is missing.  She finds it a foot away by a distinct knot in the wood floor. She notices a COPPER GLINT in the point of glass, but whe she moves it, it's gone.  She places the pieces of broken glass on the frame and stands. Out of the window directly in front of her sees:  Mr. Feu removing a DIRT COVERED SHOVEL from his trunk.  She glanc down at the picture, then back up at Mr. Feur, who carrie the shovel around back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Claire wraps up the broken picture.  She hears a car door slam and glances out the window in time to see Mr. Feur driving off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stiff autumn breeze.  Claire stands at the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Feur? She looks through the tiny crack.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? (beat) Are you there? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire glances down as she walks past THE FURROW.  She lo up at the house, which seems quite placid, then slowly he around back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes in the lake view from the large porch.  The win really blowing.  Her eye catches on something.  Propped against the back door...

dialogues.speaker: THE SOIL COVERED SHOVEL
dialogues.text: Claire takes a pinch of soil from the shovel and tastes i then knocks at the back door.  There's no answer.  She kn again.  Nothing.  She's turning to go, then the door swin open.  The smile fades from Claire's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The immense MR. FEUR filling the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running late here.  I just came back for my briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Well, I wanted to stop by to welcome you to the uh, to the neighborhood.  I'm Claire Spencer.  From next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This really isn't a good time. He starts to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe your wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growing cold) She isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When...when will she be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-kay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. Slam.  And Claire is staring at a closed door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean she's gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Jody knife slowly through the water in the Spencer's sailboat heading back toward the dock, the OLD LIGHTHOUSE, the BRIDE in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not there.  I haven't seen her since that morning.  Well, I mean, I've never actually seen her, but I'm telling you, she's disappeared. Jody finishes securing a line.  The breeze is mild, so th just cruise with the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? Claire just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he killed her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  When you say it, it sounds crazy.  But what else could it all be? Jody shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, he's so kind of grim and daunting, and she sounded terrified of something. Claire glances over at Jody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing to herself) Listen to me.  I sound like some middle- aged Nancy Drew. Jody regards her.  After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telling you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...no...no...no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just bought this beautiful antique Ouija.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  That's all I need. Jody shrugs, "Have it your way."  Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look. CLAIRE'S HOUSE across the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE in the turreted window of Norman's study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the window.  Norman's at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... Claire looks over at Jody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) There.  In the study.  Don't you see-- She looks again-- nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  I'm losing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. (beat) But a presence in your house is not something to be taken lightly. Claire stares back at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in and sets down some packages.  She opens o and pulls out new toothpaste and...AN ENVELOPE-- the kind your pictures come back in.  She absently leafs through t then freezes.  She gapes at one of the shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire turns off the lights and crouches down.  She raise pair of BINOCULARS.

dialogues.speaker: BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Claire rakes the binoculars across the Feur's house...pas their car parked in front until she finds A LIGHT ON DOWNSTAIRS. The tall, powerfully built Mr. Feur walks into the room a sits by himself at the dining room table, which is set fo one.  He eats a TV dinner, slowly chewing and staring straight ahead.  He sips from a can of beer. Just then...A HAND GRABS CLAIRE'S ARM.  She lets out a screech and turns to see Norman standing beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? She glances back out the window and sees Mr. Feur standin at the window, paging the curtain.  She squats down, pull Norman with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrill whisper) Get down!  He'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also whispers) What's going on, Claire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. She peers over the sill in time to see Mr. Feur turning a from the window.  She takes Norman by the hand and leads downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads Norman in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still whispering) Why am I... (full voice) Why am I whispering in my own house? Claire turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did.  She's in the picture.  I went over to look and she's gone.  The table was set for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that means he murdered his wife? This is getting ridic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no.  The soil on the shovel, his shovel...that's clay.  It's not from here, believe me, I... (frustrated, she grabs the photos) All right, look at this. She triumphantly thrusts one before him.  Norman looks at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Look!  In the window. The ROSES.  She points out a HAZY FIGURE in the TURRETED WINDOW of the study.  Norman takes it over to the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the sun.  It's a reflection on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her!  I'm telling you.  She whispered and turned on the music.  She's trying to contact me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making sure he's got it) It's a ghost. Norman shakes his head.  He looks again at the picture, d a quick calculation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took this in the morning, didn't you? She nods slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the sun would be exactly right. She's got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why isn't it in any of the other pictures? She thrusts the batch at him.  He peruses the other few s of the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloud passed.  Or it's a bounce off the lake.  See? She looks.  He might not be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could be out.  She could be sick in bed for all we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay.  I'll bet there's...Look at this. She leads him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stares at the computer screen triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating completed solitaire game) I didn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?  Mrs. Feur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  Point is...not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  And why is she here?  If he killed her, why doesn't she haunt him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was lonely, I talked to her.  Norman, I know how it looks, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, listen to me.  I know you're under some strain.  But there's no such thing as ghosts.  They don't exist.  Our neighbor did not kill his wife, and I...wait, why aren't you dressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner.  With Stan and his new girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  Claire, we talked about it.  You didn't want Japanese, I said, Our first date since...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she seems confused) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...since Caitlin.  You don't remember this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tonight.  We're going to be-- She looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fashionably five minutes late. She bolts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive across the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned, exasperated) When you do this, I swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...Don't get all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...like it never even happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'm sure that I just... He pulls out a cell phone and punches in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restaurant.  Let them know we're running late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five minutes? The phone flashes..."NO SERVICE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not at the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I know I'm not at the center of the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be fine. They near the far side of the bridge.  Norman looks down the cell phone, which now reads, "ROAM."  He presses a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's a relief. He shoots her a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cozy, candlelit Italian place in town.  Claire and Norm arrive at the table.  STAN rises.  The chair next to him empty.  He kisses her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Stan.  Sorry we're late. (too earnest) It was my fault. She greets Stan, a friendly looking man in his forties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got here. Claire flashes a semi-playful look back at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the new squeeze? A VOICE speaks out from behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am. Claire turns to find A TALL, ELEGANT BRUNETTE standing be her.  The woman's face registers some shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you to meet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elena?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmigod... The two women embrace, then beam at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norman) We know each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope so.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Post meal.  Several empty wine bottle decorate the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had this Finnish conductor, Aki, Laki, something.  He had these ridiculous bangs. And he'd sweep them off with his baton every minute or so, and it drove us insane, remember? Claire nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looked like one of the Monkees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, Claire slept with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't sleep with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...just so she could cut them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came in from my room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interjecting) We were suite mates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's this brilliant conductor in purple briefs with no bangs cursing his ass off in Finnish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... They dissolve into giggles.  Norman and Stan smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stan) I made an honest woman out of her. Elena puts her hand on Claire's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stan) You should have heard her play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We both auditioned for the Philharmonic. One cello position open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I kicked ass.  My best stuff.  Then I stood in the hallway and listened to her audition...and I cried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's making this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  Couldn't pick up my cello for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Elena looks at Claire, then smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got it. (beat) Turned it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met a dashing young grad student after a recital one night... Claire puts her arm around Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and three months later I was married. He squeezes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks into the work room with the portable phone t her ear and a cup of Jody's special tea.  She sniffs it a makes a face as she turns on the computer.  After several rings a GIRL picks up on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Caitlin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Can you hang up?  I'm trying to make a call. The line goes dead.  Claire hits redial and gets...a BUSY SIGNAL.  She clicks the phone off as the computer boots u Claire puts the phone down and starts a game of Alice's Solitaire.  She turns a card and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, that's tricky.  Sure could use some help. She waits, the cursor blinks benignly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks into the room and notices STEAM wafting from th cracked bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters the steamy bathroom.  The tub is nearly overflowing with water.  She squats down to drain the tub She stops, feeling watched, then slowly peers behind her. one's there.  Claire reaches toward the water to yank the plug's chain, then freezes.  In the bathwater's still reflection she see: A PRETTY YOUNG BLOND standing beside her.  Startled, she up and slams into the SHOWER HEAD. Claire collapses over the side of the tub, her head dippi underwater.  A small cloud of red surrounds her.  Moments later, an arm wraps around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blurry shapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE'S POV - A FACE sharpens into focus hovering above her...Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits on the bed.  Norman dabs the blood from a tin cut on the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need a shrink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Harvey says he's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can it hurt to talk to someone? She goes to her dresser and gets a PRESCRIPTION BOTTLE an starts to open it.  Norman gently places a hand on her ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. She shoots him a look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised. ...and puts the pills down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Claire, she's been a huge part of your life for seventeen years.  If you weren't thrown off balance by this, then something would be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said I wasn't upset.  Of course I'm upset.  I miss her terribly.  But I know what I saw and what I heard...and it wasn't some "symptom" of something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I don't think I'm some lonely, middle-aged woman cracking up. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you lonely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  And I don't need a psychiatrist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits in a comfortable looking chair with her purse her lap, arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a smooth, mellifluous baritone) Who's idea was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine.  His.  We both...thought... She trails off.  Camera slowly pulls back to reveal, DR. TIMOTHY DRAYTON, a stocky, light skinned black man in his late forties with a kind face and piercing brown eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he was worried about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (beat) I'm sure he's hoping you'll pack me full of prozac so he can live out his life in peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There's a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, I don't know, because sometimes...sometimes I forget things...and ever since Caitlin left, ever since my daughter left for school, there've been...I fainted and... (beat) Why is this so hard? Dr. Drayton takes a little silver bowl full of shiny, red FIREBALLS next to his chair.  He proffers it to Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking. He shakes his head.  She shrugs, then grabs one and pops into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard because I'm a complete stranger and what we're talking about is incredibly personal.  Besides, the first time most people come here, a part of them is wondering if I'm gonna think they're crazy. She sucks on the fireball and slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm required to have at least three sessions in order to commit. Her eyes get a little wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a joke. She manages an unsteady smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some training at helping people through the stressful moments in life, one of which you may or may not be experiencing.  If you want to get some stuff off your chest, great.  If not... He smiles and shrugs, "no problem."  She stares at him fo moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: fireball) These are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. She studies him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a ghost in my house. He nods slightly, as if she's told him, "I have some anxiety."  Claire goes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finished my solitaire game and turned on the radio...she likes rock and roll. Angry rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know it's a she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw her in the water.  Beside me.  She was filling the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does she look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty.  She's a blond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea who she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...I'd rather not say...just yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I should do? He thinks for a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to contact her. Claire nearly swallows her fireball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to communicate with her somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think that'll help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't hurt.  And I think it's important you find out what she wants. Claire ponders this for a moment, then looks back up at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you humoring me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. She seems satisfied by his sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  My aunt used to use my uncle's old pajamas and a candle. He stands.  Claire nods, then stands.  She smiles too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this time okay? He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in carrying a half-empty bottle of wine.  Sh looks over at Jody, who turns off the lights.  Jody then strikes a match and lights a LARGE CANDLE.  She unveils h carved ANTIQUE OUIJA BOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, jokey) Are we hoping the ghost is going to have to pee? Jody turns to her, deadly serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this where you saw her? Claire's smile fades.  She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this is where she'll be. They sit cross legged, the board between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place your fingers on the planchette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planchette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This. Jody indicates the wooden pointing device.  Each woman gr an edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a low voice) We wish to commune with the spirit of Mrs. Feur. (to Claire) What's her first name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Jody closes her eyes.  Claire follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I call forth the entity that is haunting this house. They look down at the planchette, which hasn't moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Feur? There's still no movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Jody focuses intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal yourself to us. A long moment passes.  It's starting to seem like a bust. Suddenly, THE CANDLE FLARES.  Even Jody seems startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the spirit) Who...who are you? At first, nothing happens.  Then, slowly, the planchette starts to move across the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you doing that? Jody shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing that. The planchette comes to rest on the letter "M."  Moments later, it starts to move again drifting over and stopping

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: M-E...
dialogues.text: It starts to drift again, moving slowly toward the space between "E" and "F."  The planchette stops on "F."  Jody removes her fingers from the device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mef?  What's Mef?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's initials.  F is Feur.  It's her. Suddenly, the CANDLE starts flickering strangely and THE PLANCHETTE SLIDES JERKILY ON ITS OWN...M-E-F, M-E-F...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Jody stumbles backwards, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that? Claire leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ghost) What happened to you? The CANDLE GOES OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Jody bolts.  Claire follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire catches up to the completely spooked Jody outside work room.  She holds onto her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody, wait. Cooper's growling in the work room.  They look in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, this is...this is... Claire, transfixed, walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at the computer screen, which is being filled letters at an amazing speed. MEFMEFMEFMEFMEFMEFMEF... She hears the front door swing open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire arrives at the open front door in time to see the Karman-Ghia tearing out of the driveway.  She turns and g back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: She edges into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture has, once again, tumbled from its spot.  She drops to her knees over the picture.  This time THE GLASS SHATTERED.  When she picks out the remaining shards, the newspaper photo slides out.  Claire glances at the benign news stories on the back. She looks around and spots a piece of glass wedged in a c in the floor boards by the knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The piece of glass, wedged next to what looks like A COPP COIN in the crack.  It's too big to be a penny. She tries to use the piece of glass to pry it free, but recoils.  A tiny drop of blood appears on her finger, whi she pops into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still sucking on her finger, Claire walks in and begins t clean up the remains of the seance.  She bends down to pi up the Ouija board, then stops when she notices that the is again full to the brink of overflowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?! Claire peers around, frustrated, half waiting for a reply There is only silence.  She reaches in to pull the plug, nearly scalding her hand.  When she turns for a hand towe she finds a message traced into the steamed-up mirror:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She draws in a breath and darts out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman nods to a SECURITY GUARD as he leaves a darkened university building.  He sees Claire standing at the foot the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed her.  I'm not crazy.  He killed her and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Feur thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And he's going to get away with it. Norman's momentarily speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a seance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody and I.  And she was there, Norman, she was.  It scared Jody so bad she had to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody brought a Ouija board and we summoned her. He regards her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you angry at me? This stops Claire in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you resent how busy I've been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you...?  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I've got at stake with this paper.  You know that.  I can't help but think that you're doing this now to hurt me, or to sabotage me somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sabotage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since the accident I've been worried that you'd been unhappy, or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accident...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then you've been so much better...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, this isn't about you.  This is something that's happening to me.  It's not to get even...and it's not some warped bid for attention.  Some strange things are happening in our house, whether you believe in them or not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Not sweetheart, no.  I believe in what's happening.  I don't want to, but I do.  I guess I was foolish enough to think that would be enough for you. She turns on a heel and walks toward her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman catches up to her as a LARGE CROWD is filing out o the concert hall next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're overreacting. She turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me how to react! Norman glances around at the crowded sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will NOT. Some of the bystanders stop to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still loud) Maybe you're right.  Maybe I'm losing my mind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Claire, please... Claire leans in and lowers her voice without diminishing intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But what if I'm not?  What if she died in terror and betrayal and some part of her can't move on while that's unresolved.  Can't you just... Something behind him catches her eye.  She trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow... Claire walks past him toward the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, please... There's a dangerous energy to her walk.  People step out the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks past several cars until she sees the one she after.  MR. FEUR steps out from behind the open trunk of old Buick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking up) You! He looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're smart, don't you?  You think you got away clean.  Well, I know you killed her.  You drowned her in the bathtub and got rid of her somewhere and I'm gonna find her, you murdering sonofabitch. Mr. Feur stares, dazed, through the tirade.  Norman arriv at her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffing) Give me that shit.  Your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Mr. Feur) I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over Norman) Then where is she? He stares at both Spencers for a moment.  Then calls past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey... Claire and Norman turn.  A BLOND WOMAN backs out of the passenger seat.  She turns.  IT'S NOT THE FACE CLAIRE HAS SEEN.  Claire looks sucker punched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits back in the chair.  She looks drained.  A sof rain taps against the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And his face...it seemed so gentle, and I knew...in that second I knew that I'd imagined the whole thing. Dr. Drayton takes this in.  She seems genuinely frightene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what we're here for. He watches her calmly, some empathy on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whether you imagined it or not, you actually saw and heard things that frightened you...that gave you reason for concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend saw them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there something called group hysteria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you influenced her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.  I don't know.  I just know that when all this was happening, I felt, some part of me felt...alive.  Like somebody needed me.  And the more I reached out to, it, the fuller it became.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying you willed these events to happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm very confused right now. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever find out what it wanted? Claire remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said, "You know."  That I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? (beat) Guess. Claire ponders this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt...pain.  That she'd been hurt by someone. (beat) This is great.  I'm trying to intuit the emotions of a figment of my--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  No.  Well, in the accident I was injured, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in an accident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last year.  I drove my car up a tree. Nothing serious, this... (she indicates her scar) ...a minor concussion.  But the car looked bad.  It could have been bad.  I think it scared the hell out of Norman. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your marriage? Claire's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, don't hold back. Dr. Drayton smiles kindly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's been amazing throughout this whole thing.  Patient and caring... (beat) I mean, sure, he can be obsessed with his work, and...it's a very important time right now with all that.  But, sometimes...I mean with everybody, right? Sometimes it's like... She trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he doesn't...see me, or, you know, that I'm...that's something's wrong...with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That can't feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't...Okay, look, I see what you're doing here, and that's, I'm sorry, but that's not it.  My marriage is fine. I've had some kind of "empty-nest" episode where I saw some things that weren't there.  Let's deal with that.  I'm willing to deal with that. (beat) I just don't want to go conjuring problems where none exist. Claire finishes her tirade.  Dr. Drayton lets her settle a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough.  But you should know that I'm far less concerned with whether things you saw "existed," than I am with why you saw them. She takes in the ramifications of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire's carrying some cuttings into the house.  She hear knock at the gate, walks over and opens it to discover... Feur.  The real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For scaring you like I did.  When I thought about what that must have seemed like that day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then you weren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  I'm sorry. There's an awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some iced tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much. Claire leads her toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pours Mrs. Feur a glass of iced tea from a pitcher She's small and delicate looking with big, watery eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your house is so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these roses.  They're much prettier up close. She regards Mrs. Feur for a moment.  She seems skittish a shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...there's something I have to ask you. Mrs. Feur waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day...at the fence.  You seemed terrified.  I don't think I was imagining that. There's a pause.  Mrs. Feur looks down into her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?  What were you so afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to think I'm crazy or something. A tiny smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this week. She looks away for a moment, then looks back at Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever felt so completely consumed by a feeling for someone that you couldn't breathe?  That the time together is so passionate and consuming that you felt physical pain when they would leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't catch my breath.  That's not a metaphor, that's...And I panicked.  I never dreamed anyone would hear me back there... (beat) I tried to leave him.  Went to my mother's in Boston.  He brought my things up and pleaded with me to come home. Claire is mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must think I'm pathetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry that I frightened you like that.  But I was so touched by your concern.  I've been lonely here. (beat) Perhaps we could be friends. Claire stares at this strange, passionate woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would like that. Mrs. Feur smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire pulls up in front of a large NEW YORK HOTEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on a cell phone) ...I'm pulling up, Yuri.  I'll see you for dinner. (to Claire) Sure you won't stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine.  I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tempting her) Really big bed. She smiles and shakes her head.  Norman kisses her goodby then grabs his bag from the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
