dialogues.text: Call ya later. He starts to walk into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you glad you married me? He turns.  She's standing next to the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you glad?  I'm glad. Norman walks over to her and cradles her chin with his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) You know I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (She gazes at him, then softly) You sat in front...I saw you there... Norman takes his cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were lost in the music...eyes closed...your chest heaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt you...looking through me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We walked all night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me that I was... He gently cups her chin in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...that you were everything I'd ever dreamed of. She smiles, kisses him warmly, then gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands outside Caitlin's Columbia dorm, watching y lives in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks past a number of doors.  Music booms out of shards of a conversation out of another.  Finally, she arrives at a door that says "Fur is murder."  She smiles herself and knocks.  There's no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out. Claire turns to find an attractive YOUNG MAN standing at elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're playing at CBGB's down on Bowery. Probably won't be back for awhile.  You her mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Who was playing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch.  Caitlin's band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Caitlin's band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  They're really good.  I would have gone, but I have a paper. (beat) And I'm not just saying that because you're a mother. Claire nods slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She walks down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire moves past a huge, BLACK SKINHEAD DOORMAN into an entrance area in the dark throbbing punk club.  She looks over the MOB OF SEETHING YOUNG PEOPLE, swaying to a pulsi power-pop band.  PUNKS and CLUB KIDS push past her as the move into the throng.  She looks up and her face changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaggy trio of musicians on the stage, pumping through jangly, but surprisingly melodic song.  Her eyes race acr the faces of a BUTCH FEMALE DRUMMER, an emaciated GUITARIST/SINGER and stop on the BASS PLAYER...Caitlin. rocks back and forth to her own hypnotic bass line, EYES CLOSED, SWAYING TO THE MUSIC. Claire is transfixed, her face a mix of pride and sadness The song ends and Caitlin's eyes open.  She smiles for a moment, then the smile fades as she spots Claire.  Panick Claire ducks behind a pillar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last groups of YOUNG PEOPLE file out of the club.  A couple of them glance at Claire, who seems very out of pl standing on the Bowery late at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom? She turns to see Caitlin standing before her, a bass guit case on a strap over her shoulder.  There's an awkward pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I'm sorry.  I wanted to tell you. But it never felt right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Caitlin stares at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to bring up memories.  I didn't want to do anything that might make you regret your choices. Claire winces silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, Dad would have freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think playing in a band called "Bitch" might put a dent in the whole "perfect family" thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is.  Can we please not do that? Please?  Cause it is. Claire doesn't disagree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves you very much.  He just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he does. Beat.  Claire studies her surprisingly strong daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  The one thing in life that I definitely don't regret...is the choice. I made to be your mother. They hug.  For a moment, Claire's got her little girl bac Her eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) It got so bad your father almost had to put me away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started seeing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ghost? Beat.  Claire stares at her daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But once I heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone crying.  A girl. (beat) I thought I was crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Then we both are. Caitlin nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a large cocktail party.  The house is crowded with PROFESSORS, ADMINISTRATORS, and their SPOUSES.  PRESIDENT TEMPLETON, a frosty-haired, avuncular chap, greets them w his WIFE, a sharp looking woman in her late fifties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember my wife, Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands) Of course.  You must be so proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norman) Everyone's very anxious to shake hands with our newest academic celebrity. She takes their coats.  Dean Templeton leads them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must've been some paper.  Your father would be very proud. This seems to strike a nerve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Claire notices this and squeezes his hand.  Templeton lea Norman into a large living room which is filled with colleagues.  Several of them turn and begin clapping.  Ot follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands at a small bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bartender) White wine please. She scans the party and spots the Feurs deep in some inti conversation with each other.  She's speaking about somet astonishing.  He's rapt. Claire locates Norman in a corner listening as some AGED ALUMNUS holds forth.  He sees her and mouths, "I'm sorry. He points to his watch and flashes five fingers.  She smi and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess I'm not much of a medium. She turns to see Jody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody... They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for leaving, but I mean, Jesus, Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mess around with this stuff, but I never thought anything would happen. Claire looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Norman know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody, she's alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Feur.  She's alive.  I met her. She's really sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  It wasn't anything.  I've been on edge lately.  Maybe since the accident. And I'd prefer, I really would, to just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something was there.  You saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Now I talked to Sela and there's a guy, this Pakistani guy down in Hartford...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hartford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's the real thing.  Specializes in cases like this, like yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Jody, listen to me.  You have to listen to me.  This is not something that I can do right now.  Whatever it was, it's gone.  I need it to be gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Claire--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Jody recognizes her fragility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to find a bathroom.  I'll call you. Jody nods as Claire walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands in the spacious powder room, checking her makeup in the mirror.  Mrs. Templeton enters from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you holding up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just fine.  It's a lovely party. The two women fix their makeup side-by-side in the mirror

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman was telling me the dream house is finally finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful.  It's good to see you two doing so well. Claire looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how hard it can be sometimes. Claire turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  What can be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't think I've seen you since the reception at Dean Ackerman's last year. Claire's still in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the Dupont Chair. (off Claire's look) I swear.  I'm becoming the nosy old lady I used to run from at Amherst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm just not sure what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was just...some tension.  You were upset.  I remember being concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toward the end.  You remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering) Ohhh yes.  No, no.  Just a little, you know...We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad.  Pardon my intrusiveness, but we do have to stick together you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wives. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Mrs. Templeton leaves.  Claire looks into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire and Norman walk toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she said it, there was something familiar...but no. He looks at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cheap wine glass from the caterers.  You started crying.  I tried to comfort you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (something's triggered) In the living room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoved me away and ran out to the patio.  I took you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why?  I can't understand how I could just completely--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was maybe a week after the accident. We were moving.  It was a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetheart, it was over a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me? He stops, takes her shoulders gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) Nothing.  Nothing at all.  It's been a hard year.  But you're better now.  And things are really looking up for us.  So let's try to enjoy that. (gently) Please? She thinks for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Yes.  That's what I want. She takes his hand and kisses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks up to the door.  When she touches the knob s hears...the WHISPERING.  She opens the door and moves int

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same intense whispered exchange.  She glances into th mirror and sees...SHAPES MOVING, BODIES, A FLASH OF SILVE She turns the corner and again...NO ONE'S THERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks in and stands before: The repaired photograph of herself and Norman...at the pa for the DUPONT CHAIR. She takes it from the wall, stares at it for a moment, th SMASHES IT ON THE EDGE OF THE DESK.  She extricates the picture from the broken glass.  The caption reads: "Dr. Norman Spencer being awarded the distinguished Dupon Chair in Genetics by Dean of Sciences Torvald Ackerman." She stares at the picture for a moment, then flips it ove and scans the stories on the back.  One tells of a hotly contested city council race, another contains details of large alumni donation to the university. She notices the bottom corner of another story she hadn't noticed before.  It's only a small portion of one column, it seems to detail the search for A MISSING GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, online, logs onto a missing persons website.  She narrows her search to NEW ENGLAND.  A screen pops up with list of names.  She scrolls down the list until she finds...FRANK, MADISON ELIZABETH.

dialogues.speaker: M-E-F...
dialogues.text: Claire double clicks on it, then waits breathlessly as a blurry cyber photo fills the screen.  Slowly, higher resolution moves down the image. IT'S THE GHOST. Under the photo is the legend:

dialogues.speaker: "DISAPPEARED
dialogues.text: Claire stares at the familiar face, then shakily hits PRI

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Claire is staring down at the girl's face on the print ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) ...she was practically a townie.  Grew up in Bradford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she was never found?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Nah.  She was a live wire.  Had this old Mustang Fastback.  It's gone too.  Most of her friends think she's tooling around Mexico somewhere.  Police downgraded her to a runaway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr... She glances at the byline on the back of the newspaper ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "by Neil McCann"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...McCann. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is unpacking NOTES and CHEMICALS from his LEATHER Claire walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember this? She places the printout on his desk.  He takes a long loo it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this that girl from last year? Claire nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know her? Norman looks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may have seen her on campus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) I'm afraid to ask what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (solemnly) It's her.  This is the woman who I've seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  The ghost. Norman leaves the hung frame and walks over to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was Mrs. Feur, but it's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly overlapping) Stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm positive this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...Please stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Madison Fra--

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Claire falls silent, Norman turns from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Claire, I've tried to be there.  I know you're going through something that I can't understand...but it's enough. Claire looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go see someone?  Together? Should we call Dr. Drayton? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then what?  Claire, what?  Tell me what I can do. Long pause.  Claire looks up, then timidly holds out the printout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. Norman's jaw tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to make you angry.  But she's here.  And I don't know why... He silently walks out of the room.  Claire stares down at face in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire parks in front of a small, clapboard house in a neighborhood that is decidedly less upscale than her own. She gets out and tentatively walks up to the tiny porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire rings the bell.  A DRAWN LOOKING WOMAN in her earl fifties answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to talk to you about Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know where she is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please leave me alone. She starts to close the door.  Claire leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my friend. The woman stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was.  We were...acquainted.  I've been away for awhile.  When I came back... She studies Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never mentioned you. Claire doesn't know what to say to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then again, she didn't say much about her college friends. She gives Claire the once over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm watchin' my shows. She motions Claire in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits on a couch in the cramped living room.  Mrs. Frank serves up a mug of coffee.  A soap plays silently o old 19" RCA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just plain old coffee.  None of that mocha nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. She sizes Claire up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look a little old for a student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not.  We...we met at a party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds about right.  Never understood how a girl that wild got all A's.  Sure didn't get it from me.  They wanted to put her in a special school for the gifted when she was young.  Maddie wouldn't hear about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never mentioned her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well she wouldn't.  He left when she was twelve.  Never spoke about him after that. There's a silence.  Mrs. Frank stares at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't need the sound.  You can pretty much tell what's happening by the faces.  Turn it up sometimes, though.  Feels like someone's here. Claire doesn't know what to say.  Mrs. Frank turns to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like that.  Doesn't seem real.  No note.  Nothing. (beat) Cops say she'll be back.  I just wanna know what happened. Claire stares at this tough, tragic woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna see her room? Claire nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters the room.  Her face freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL POSTERS FOR ALTERNATIVE AND METAL BANDS, side by with ACADEMIC PLAQUES AND AWARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full scholarships.  Princeton too.  She wanted to stay close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have been very proud. She nods.  Claire moves along looking at pictures.  Some different men, others with rough looking friends.  Claire stops at a picture tucked into a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison singing at a recital of some kind.  She's lovely, with striking GREEN EYES.  Around her neck is a distincti SILVER NECKLACE, with a perfectly wrought, SILVER ROSEBUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a pretty voice.  Surprised she didn't major in music. (beat) That's the last picture. A phone rings in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'cuse me. Claire's eye is pulled past the picture into the mirror, reflection of something pinned to the edge of a bulletin board.  She turns and moves over to: A SHORT BLOND BRAID.  She reaches out to touch it.  Clair hears footsteps.  Mrs. Frank leans back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're calling me in to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be going anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Frank walks Claire out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'hear anything you'll let me know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Claire walks to her car.  She turns and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biology.  She wanted to be a doctor. Claire stands, frozen, as Mrs. Frank disappears into the little house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire shuts the blinds, then places the large candle on floor, then places the MISSING GIRL PRINTOUT at the base the candle.  On top if it, she places THE BRAID. Then Claire lights the candle, puts the braid on the pict and hunches over it, whispering intensely:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know the truth. She waits a beat.  Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madison, please...help me. Nothing happens.  She looks around at the seance props. She stands and places her hands on the sink.  She glances herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing? Suddenly, her head droops over, she shudders softly.  Whe she looks back into the mirror, her eyes are a DEEP GREEN She hears the front door open downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...Anybody home?! A strange smile creeps across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV - Gliding down the stairs and into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refrigerator door is open.  Norman is leaning over. his ass protrudes.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Norman closes the refrigerator door and sees Claire stand before him, stripped down to a skirt and slip top.  There different physicality to her movements...a different rhyt to her speech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dr. Spencer. Norman smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Spencer. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forbidden fruit... She takes the apple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a problem with that... ...then takes a ravenous bite and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman finds Claire seated on his desk, her legs spread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it your not mad at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't go that far. She grabs his belt and pulls him into her, then holds the apple to his mouth.  Norman tentatively takes a bite.  Sh mashes it slowly into his mouth until he recoils slightly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Okay... When he chews the huge bite, a glistening drop of juice r down his chin.  Claire leans forward and licks it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's gotten into you? She just smiles mischievously, then starts kissing him. looks like she's eating his lips.  Norman's getting hot. bites down on a lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too rough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when? Something about this response frightens him.  Claire yank Norman's belt open.  He steps back, tripping over his castered desk chair.  She's on top of him in a flash, sit astride him.  She speaks in a forceful, sexy whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this, this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pinning his hands above his head) Why don't you shut up and fuck me, Professor. She grinds up against him.  Suddenly, something pulls her to the hallway. POV - The COAT RACK MIRROR, now from inside the study.  I it's reflection:  ANOTHER CLAIRE, shorter hair, stunned expression.  Where she's standing...it's DAYTIME. Claire leans over him until they're nose-to-nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense whisper) I think she's starting to suspect something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning down) Your wife...

dialogues.speaker: STOP IT
dialogues.text: Norman shoves her off of him onto the floor.  He stands, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?! In a moment, it's Claire again, stunned and trembling aga the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself, remembering) "You know..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattled) What? She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flooding back to her) I came to work in the garden and I saw you with her...in my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I snuck back to my car, trying to convince myself it never happened.  And when I woke up in the hospital...somehow it hadn't.  Until now. He just stares at her, his face anguished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was last year.  We were having troubles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you fucked a student?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching for her) That's not what I'm sayi--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling back) DON'T touch me.  Just get away from me. Go! He's frozen.

dialogues.speaker: I SAID GET OUT
dialogues.text: Norman doesn't move.  He's never seen her like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... She bolts toward the living room.  He follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (welling up) Claire, please don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you think I would do?  Jesus Christ!  I gave up my life and my music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never asked you to quit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh BULLSHIT.  You had to topple perfect Daddy and that meant perfect wife, perfect family... He follows her as she searches for her purse and keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THAT'S NOT TRUE!  You wanted to quit!  And then when you did, you hated me for it... so you gave it all to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Caitlin!! She wheels on him with fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her out of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then out of nowhere, some bright young woman found me attractive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would do anything just to be around me.  And I slipped.  God help me, I slipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to listen to this. Claire goes to leave, Norman blocks her path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to break it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have tried harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seething) Get out of my way. She brushes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He catches up, beside himself.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE DON'T GO
dialogues.text: Claire's nearly disarmed by this rare emotional outburst. She turns at the door and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it impossible for me to be someone you could be in love with. She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, rumpled and unshaven, is passed out on the couch, half empty whiskey bottle beside him on the coffee table. awakens to find Claire sitting across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to answer one question. He waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have anything to do with her disappearance? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Claire goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was damaged and unstable.  The more I tried to distance myself, the more desperate she became.  Finally, she showed up at the new house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did she know where it was? He stares off.  The reality sinks in for Claire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Our dream house. Norman can hardly look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was out of control.  She said she was going to kill herself...or you.  I never thought she'd go through with any of it, but then she was gone... He trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know that for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she did, Norman.  What else could it be? The enormity of this hits Norman.  His head drops into hi hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, what have I done?  How could I have let this into our lives? He looks up at her, teary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She gets up and walks out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old industrial loft filled with finished and half-fini oil paintings.  Jody brings Claire some tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and everything I have, everything I thought my life was...Christ when I think of all the lies... Jody looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? (beat) Jody what? Jody looks up, tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...you knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was down in Adamant...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adamant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artsy little village down seven.  There's a guy there who sells my work.  I had just dropped off some paintings and as I got in my car...I saw Norman sitting at this little cafe. Claire waits for her to continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started to walk over...but he wasn't alone.  A blond.  I only caught a glimpse. She was young. (beat) I should have said something right away. But I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Partly because I didn't want to hurt you...but partly...partly because I was relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relieved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had just been left by Richard.  I was bitter and miserable and for some fucked up reason, it made me feel better that your life wasn't as perfect as it seemed. Claire nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time I finally got up the nerve to tell you, Stan called from the hospital and it was too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late?  Jody, it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone?  On a two lane road?  With a ton of Valium in your system? Claire walks over to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got there first.  Stan covered up the pills and I had it out with Norman.  He seemed desperate not to lose you.  He promised to handle it.  And we all let it drop away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a terrible friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Claire turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I expect you to tell me something that I wouldn't even tell myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she was dangerous before--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She could have hurt me if she wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that. (beat) If it's your belief that gives her form, then you've got to shut her out.  Somehow you have to break the connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  She wanted me to know the truth.  Now that I do...I think she's at peace. Jody isn't as sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks in.  She notices the clock on the range is d She flips on a light.  Nothing happens.  Worried, she hea upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire enters.  The bed is empty.  The shower is running the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE - CLAIRE...her face a mask of terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BATHTUB, with the shower curtain drawn around it, the water blasting.  Norman's limp hand pokes through the curtain.  AN ELECTRIC CORD leads from the mirror socket i the tub. Claire races over and rips the plug from the wall.  She t the SHOWER CURTAIN AWAY to find A BLUISH NORMAN lying, unconscious in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  Please no... She hugs her face to his chest until she picks up a heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!!  Wake up!  Please! Claire shakes him to no effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...NORMAN! She slaps him on the face...once, then twice.  He suddenl sucks in a gulp of air, begins struggling and dazedly ret to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me...it's me... Sobbing, she shuts off the squeaky faucets and struggles pull him upright.  She discovered HER BLOWDRYER in the tu and hurls it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits beside Norman on the bed as two E.M.T.'s, an GUY and a HEAVY WOMAN pack up.  Stan's on the phone, Jody to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vitals are good.  I'd take it easy for a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. The E.M.T.'s leave as Stan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll take you for a CAT scan tomorrow if you're feeling dizzy at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be necessary.    He glances at Claire as he walks Stan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless there's a miracle drug for clumsiness. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody, she tried to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need help.  Please let me call the medium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could take days.  I need to do something now.  Don't you see?  She wants us dead. Jody thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alight, alright.  Stay calm.  You opened this door.  There's got to be a way that you can close it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea.  But, I mean, I'm just making this up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire's staring down at the PRINTOUT.  She's kneeling at edge of the dock.  From her pocket she produces THE BLOND BRAID and a piece of TWINE.  She wraps the braid up in th printout with a rock and secures it with the twine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Better or worse, he's mine. She tosses the little parcel into the dark water.  Bubble stream up.  In the bubbles, Claire sees...THE PALE SHAPE, which slowly becomes THE DROWNED GIRL, staring up from beneath the dark water. Claire wants to pull away, but she's transfixed.  Madison reaches up toward the surface.  As the bubble diminish, s seems to be FADING AWAY.  When she's gone, Claire reaches toward the water.  When her finger touches the surface... WHOOSH!  She's sucked down into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman glances out of the window in time to see a splash the dock.  He races out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Claire struggles furiously as the unseen attacker drags h deeper into the murky depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sprints toward the dock.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: As he oxygen begins to run out, Claire screams desperatel her hand plunges into the muddy bottom. Suddenly, she's released.  She yanks her hand free, the s swirls revealing...a COPPER COLORED GLINT in the mud. NORMAN'S HAND grasps Claire's ankle and pulls her upwards

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman helps Claire, coughing, onto the dock.  They hold other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? She nods, catching her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see, she's trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't be here without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but I am.  She was there and then she was gone.  I felt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire... She stares into the still water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire in bed with a blanket wrapped around her.  Norman walks in with some steaming mulled cider.  He stokes the blazing fire.  He sits on the edge of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's going to take awhile before things are back...until they're better than before.  But you've given us a chance to make a fresh start.  And I'm going to spend the rest of my life making you glad that you did. The gaze at each other.  Tentatively, she places a hand o his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, dressed in a warm sweater, finishes wrapping her rosebushes for the winter.  She picks up a basket of clip flowers and heads inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the doorknob and listens for the whispering.  A is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks into the mirror and sees only the study and the lake behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire places the roses in a vase on Norman's desk, and i doing so, accidentally knocks it over. With a towel she mops up the water which has dripped onto wooden floor.  The stream has flowed over to the knot and dripped into the crack.  Claire stares down at THE STRANG COPPER COIN. She grabs a letter opener from Norman's desk and pries th coin out.  It's actually a SMALL BRASS KEY, the head of w is THREE INTERLOCKING CIRCLES.  She stares at it for a moment, then places it in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands toward the bow watching the sunset.  The le on the surrounding hills are stunning.  Norman appears be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last sail of the year. She gazes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible.  We should take a drive before they're gone.  Spend the night at some cozy little bed and breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look for antiques...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.  There's some great places nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a reflex) Adamant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little village down seven.  Supposed to be charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can stop there for lunch. He wraps an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you'd like. She leans against him, staring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody and Claire return from a walk.  Norman has the boat the trailer and is securing a tarp over it.  They stop un a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he acted like he'd never heard of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jody he was lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he was?  Do you think he wanted to bring that up again just when you're trying to make a new start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to put it behind him, Claire. You should too. Norman smiles and waves.  They wave back as they arrive a the Karman-Ghia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a beautiful life.  And even with this, it's always been clear that he loves you. (beat) I've come to think that's all that really matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Claire.  You hear something... change the subject.  You find something... get rid of it, throw it in the lake. (beat) You know what happened.  The rest is only details.  And no one's ever glad they got a hold of those.  If you want to put this back together...just let it go. Jody drives off.  Claire walks over to Norman.  She hugs tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cooking you dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I'll do the shopping. They kiss.  She heads to the Volvo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is approaching a country market.  She spots a litt sign with an arrow: ADAMANT - 11 mi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates for a moment, then take the turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands on a street in the quaint little village. looks around, spots a little cafe with outdoor tables.  A friendly old HIPPIE WOMAN walks out of a store.  She watc Claire gazing around. HIPPIE WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for? CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really know. HIPPIE WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what you mean. She ambles off across the street.  Claire watches her go. Then notices a sign hung out above a little shop.  THREE INTERLOCKED CIRCLES.  She walks toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stands in front of the store window.  A sign in th window identifies it as "The Sleeping Dog - Hand wrought jewelry and gifts."  Claire tries to open the door, but s a closed sign. She steps back out to the window and looks in.  On displa are a selection of handcrafted jewelry and curios. Suddenly her eye stops on a small silver bracelet with an intricate ROSEBUD. Her eye travels up and behind it to the back of the displ where she spots, a small ORNATE COPPER CHEST.  Protruding from its lock...THE INTERLOCKED CIRCLES.  Claire looks li she's been punched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire glances over at the soundly sleeping Norman.  She gingerly slides out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire sits among the boxes, leafing through the photo al tracking the years of their life.  Her hands tremble. Finally she reaches the picture of their wedding, reaches behind the photo and produces...THE KEY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire in her nightgown and a jacket, walks slowly down t dock.  An expensive looking flashlight illuminates her pa She stops and stares out at the moonlit lake. She holds out a fist.  Her fingers unfold and in her palm lies THE KEY.  She holds the key out over the water and stands there, frozen.  The lighthouse beam sweeps past he once...then again. Claire pulls her hand back and holds the key to her chest then carefully places it on the dock.  She very deliberat takes off her jacket and slippers, steps to the edge of t dock, shines the flashlight on the dark water...then step off the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN ANGUISHED CRY from downstairs.  Norman bolts upright i bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman walks through the darkened house into the moonlit room.  He pulls up short when he sees the strongbox sitti closed on his desk.  He looks around, sees the room is em and walks over to it. The mud and silt has been wiped from the top, on which is engraved:  To N.C.S. with love always, M.E.F. He pulls open the lid and tentatively peers inside. THE LIGHTS SWITCH ON. Claire stands in the doorway, holding out the SILVER ROSE NECKLACE. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for this? Norman stares at her dumbly. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out there isn't she?  She's in the lake. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Don't...you don't understand what this is. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I, Norman?  YOU KEPT THE FUCKING NECKLACE.  Of a woman you killed! NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nearly hysterical) I did NOT!  I did not kill anyone.  Jesus. Claire, listen to me.  I walked in and she was lying there dead.  I swear to you.  On my life!  She took pills and she killed herself in our house to destroy me!  To destroy us!  If I hadn't stopped by here before school, the painters would have-- CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe you. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT'S TRUE.  That's...you have to believe me!  Oh God, I'm telling you the truth! (beat, fighting tears) I did what I had to, Claire.  She was gone.  There was nothing I could do for her.  I did...I put her in the lake.  I rolled the car in...and I watched it sink. (beat) And I've lived with that image ever since. (beat) I couldn't just stand there while everything-- my career, us, everything, just washed away.  Don't you see, Claire?  She's doing this!  This is exactly what she wants you to think! Claire's lip is quivering with confusion. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what's true anymore. (beat) But that girl must be brought up.  Now do you want to call the police?  Or should I? Norman stares at the phone.  He's a wreck. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I can't live with it anymore. He takes the phone, punches in three numbers, waits. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Dr. Norman Spencer.  No, it's not an emergency. He looks at Claire. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some information about a missing girl, Madison Frank...Yes.  Could you send an officer?  Fifteen Willoughby, about a mile before the bridge...Thank you. He hangs up.  Long silence.  They look at each other. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing. (beat) I'm going to get cleaned up. He walks out.  Claire walks over and stands before the bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire walks into the bedroom.  The shower can be heard through the bathroom door, which is partially ajar.  Stea drifts out through the crack. She stands in her dressing room and catches sight of her weary, distraught countenance in the mirror.  She glances down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The necklace still in her hand. She looks up again into the mirror.  Her face goes strang blank and, almost mechanically, she clasps the necklace o her neck. Suddenly, she stares over at the CORDLESS PHONE lying on bed for a long moment.  She walks over, picks up the phon and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redial button. She stares at the bathroom door, then hits the button.  T rings, then: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Directory assistance... Claire's eyes widen in terror.  She clicks off the phone, and, taking it with her, starts moving toward the door to hall.  She keeps a steady eye trained on the bathroom.  S quietly pulls open the hallway door. Suddenly, A HAND WITH A WASHCLOTH IS THRUST OVER HER FACE Claire shoves Norman's hand away and runs past him down t hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's nearly at the top of the stairs when her body start falter.  She tumbles over, dropping the phone, which clat down the stairs before her. Claire is pulling herself down the stairs, moaning in ter Norman can be seen calmly following her, waiting for the Halothane to take its full effect.  Finally, she freezes. Norman picks up the phone and stands over her. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, how did we come to this? He picks her gently up in his arms and starts carrying he slowly up the stairs. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ghost stuff, that was impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ceiling, shapes... NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure you saw her that day in the house and just gradually intuited the whole damn thing.  That would be pretty astonishing.  A passive-aggressive masterpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And into the bathroom. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't until the shower that I realized you actually believed it.  Nearly froze to death waiting for you.  Thought the circuit breaker would kick back over and I'd be toast. ...then she's lowered into the tub. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crazy thing is...I have never for one moment stopped loving you. He actually wipes a tear from his eye.  He kisses her lip We can feel her revulsion.  His face over her. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Caitlin.  I'm sure in some tragic way this'll bring us closer together. He turns on the faucets, then moves out of her line of vision.  Sound of a number being dialed. NORMAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Norman.  Listen, we had a huge blowout, so I'm going down to sleep at the lab.  I guess you're out, but... maybe...if you wouldn't mind stopping by to check on her in the morning? She glances down and sees on the edge of the tub...a prescription bottle of VALIUM with her name on the label. Her eyes go wide. NORMAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...Jody, it's bad.  I've never seen her like this... (he trails off, choking up) I don't really know what to do anymore. Norman, lit periodically by the sweep of the light house beacon, squats with the phone and gazes down at her. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything ever happened to her, I'd... (beat) Anyway, thanks. Claire, mute, glances frantically around.  One of her fin begins to flutter. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearfully) I'm so sorry. The tub is rapidly filling.  He checks his watch, then reaches for the Valium.  As much from will as the drug beginning to fade, Claire lets out a garbled cry. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sloppy, guttural) Mmmuh... NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurry) Mauduh... Norman stops. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: MADISON
dialogues.text: Norman seems unnerved that she's still clinging to her be in the ghost. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a little much, don't you think? He sees the necklace on her neck. NORMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.  Can't have that. He puts down the bottle of Valium, then reaches around Claire's neck to remove the necklace.  When his hands clo on the clasp, his face suddenly goes slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His arms around MADISON'S BEAUTIFUL CORPSE. Norman explodes backwards, slamming his head into the BRA SHOWER NOZZLE.  He staggers out of the bathroom before collapsing with a thud.  The water finally rises above Claire's nostrils. Claire somehow manages to work a toe into the plug chain yank it free.  The water slowly descends. When it seems that her lungs must burst, her mouth finall clears the descending water.  She chokes in great gulps o air. The drug is finally wearing off.  Claire sits up.  Norman unconscious feet can be seen outside of the doorway.  She turns off the water and stands unsteadily. She looks around for the phone and finally spots the litt antenna protruding from under Norman.  She delicately pul the phone out of his back pocket, only to discover that i been broken by his fall.  She drops it and walks quietly of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire stumbles as fast as she can down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fumbles for some KEYS in a basket by the door, then l at the cell phone's recharging cradle.  It's empty. She spots Norman's coat hanging on the coat rack and rifl through the pockets.  She finds the phone, and flips it o to see if it's working.  A drop of something splats on th phone.  Then another.  It's blood. She looks up and sees Norman, his forehead gashed, glarin down from the landing. She reaches for the door knob, but the keys and cell phon her hand make it difficult to open.  Norman hurls himself over the banister.  THUD! A BLOODY HAND yanks her backwards.  Claire slams into the corner by the armoir.  Norman advances on her.  At the la moment, she throws her shoulder into the armoir which tum over on Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire races over to the Volvo, which is blocked by NORMA PICKUP, the dark hulk of THE SAILBOAT on a trailer behind She starts to get into the pickup, then remembers to look the bed...nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is cold and doesn't want to turn over.  She sta at the door for signs of Norman. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...come on... ...and VROOM, the truck roars to life.  Claire spews grav as she barrels the cumbersome rig out of the driveway, constantly watching the door. When she veers to the right out of the driveway, she look into the rear view mirror.  The boat momentarily blocks t open door, then clears.  Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire wheels the truck and trailer out onto a two-lane r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shivering with cold and adrenalin, she tries to work the ancient heater.  She turns onto THE BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PICKUP and BOAT race across the deserted bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire through the windshield.  Her face striped by the reflection of the bridge lights which whip one-by-one acr the windshield.  She flips open the cell phone and punche 911.  It blinks:  "NO SERVICE." CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. She glances into the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stern section of the boat's COVERING TARP untied, flapp in the breeze. Claire desperately punches the "talk" button again..."NO SERVICE."  She's past the center of the bridge.  She look again:  "ROAM."  Claire punches the talk button again.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: A TRAILER CRANK punches through the window.  Norman's arm follows, coiling like a python around Claire's neck, his visage pressed against the glass. She squashes down the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trailer starts to weave from side to side, swerving t pickup.  Claire chokes, then blacks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pickup and trailer smash through the railing, barreli over bumpy terrain straight toward the BOAT RAMP. The truck hits the water at fifty and Norman is hurtled through the rear window and into the passenger side dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is unconscious in the driver's seat, a trickle of blood runs from her nose.  Norman stirs briefly as Claire groggily comes to.  She hears the hissing of the smashed radiator, then sees Norman, a shattered bloody mess on th floor of the cab. She leans over to see if he's dead, hears a squeak and realizes that the pickup, with the BATTERED SAILBOAT AND TRAILER miraculously still attached, is rolling deeper in the water. Before she can get the door open, the truck is half submerged.  She frantically manages to lower her window halfway and starts to pull herself out. Her ribs have just cleared the glass when a bloody fist l onto her ankle and yanks her inside.  Norman pulls her do until they're face to face. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman...NO... She yanks the emergency brake, but it's too late...the submerged wheels lock and slide slowly down the mossy ram The truck is nearly submerged. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Norman, please... The water is up to the windows.  Norman shakes his head slowly as he blinks away blood from his eyes. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of Caitlin... Water sprays in through the hole in the rear window and momentarily blinds Norman.  Claire jerks free and scrambl out of the driver's side window as the truck sinks. Just as she's free of the window, she jerks to a stop.  S looks down and sees Norman, half out of the window, one h clamped onto her ankle. There is a wrenching metallic creak.  The truck lurches downward...then silence.  IT DOESN'T SINK.  The boat buoy like a fishing cork as it drifts out into the lake. The headlights pierce the darkness of the steep underwate drop off.  Claire tries to swim free, but Norman's not letting go. Suddenly metal snaps and the truck pops free of the trail It hurtles downwards and the still-glowing headlights reveal...

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: When the front of the pickup lands on the hood of the car the Mustang's windshield shatters.  A PALE SHAPE FLOATS UPWARD. Norman is suddenly entangled by something.  He tries to b it free but comes face-to-face with MADISON'S GHASTLY, DECOMPOSED FACE.  The last of his air bellows out of him scream as he releases Claire's ankle. His dead staring face separates from Madison's as the tru slowly tilts back and sinks to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire breaks the surface with a huge intake of air.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: The sound of a furious cello solo.

dialogues.speaker: COLD STARING EYES
dialogues.text: Norman, half out of the truck, arms floating. Follow his eyes to THE PALE CORPSE, drifting above, tethe to the Mustang by an old seat belt around her ankle. Move through the murky water toward the corpse's clothed back.  As she twists into view... MORPHS INTO:  MADISON'S PALE BEAUTIFUL FACE...at peace. Camera drifts, moves upward and breaks the surface as the distant lights of EMERGENCY VEHICLES approach.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERS
dialogues.text: ...filled with moist earth.  A hand tosses the clump of d onto...

dialogues.speaker: A CASKET
dialogues.text: Widen to reveal Claire, dressed in black, stepping away f the grave.  A tiny arm snakes around her waist.  She glan down to see Caitlin, her eyes shining, clasping her mothe tightly.  Claire takes a last look into the grave. CLAIRE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest in peace.

dialogues.speaker: THE GRAVESTONE
dialogues.text: Mother and daughter turn and step back.  Next to them, al in black, is MRS. FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: FINGERS
dialogues.text: Racing across the neck of a cello.  The solo continues an now reaches the difficult transition that had stumped Cla before.

dialogues.text: Claire, her hair short and sexy, eyes tightly shut, brow beaded with sweat.  The piece builds to a dark, passionat crescendo. Her eyes remain shut for a moment, then flutter open.
